query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Qual venne a Climenè, per accertarsi 2 di ciò ch’avëa incontro a sé udito, 3 quei ch’ancor fa li padri ai figli scarsi;
query.error: **English:** 1 As Clymene came to know for certain 2 what she had heard about herself, 3 he who still makes fathers sparing with their sons;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 tal era io, e tal era sentito 5 e da Beatrice e da la santa lampa 6 che pria per me avea mutato sito.
query.error: **English:** 4 such was I, and such was I perceived 5 by Beatrice and by the holy lamp 6 that had previously changed place for me.
query.result: 4 swylc wæs ic ða, and swylc ic ða wæs gesewen 5 fram Beatrican and fram ðære halgan leohte, 6 ðe ær for me hæfde hire stede awend.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Per che mia donna «Manda fuor la vampa 8 del tuo disio», mi disse, «sì ch’ella esca 9 segnata bene de la interna stampa:

query.result: 7 Forðæm min lafdið cwæð to me, "Send forð ða vlampan 8 ðines willan", heo cwæð, "swa ðæt heo cume 9 wel geðafod mid ðære innorlican stampe:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 non perché nostra conoscenza cresca 11 per tuo parlare, ma perché t’ausi 12 a dir la sete, sì che l’uom ti mesca».
query.error: **English:** 10 not because our knowledge will increase 11 through your speaking, but so that you may dare 12 to tell your thirst, so that a man may mix for you."
query.result: 10 nis ðæt forðæm ðe ure cunnunge weaxe 11 ðurh ðin spræce, ac forðæm ðe ðu ðurfe 12 ðæt ðu ðinne ðurst secge, swa ðæt ðe man gemenge."

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 così vedi le cose contingenti 17 anzi che sieno in sé, mirando il punto 18 a cui tutti li tempi son presenti;
query.error: **English:** 16 so you see contingent things 17 before they are in themselves, gazing at the point 18 at which all times are present;

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 mentre ch’io era a Virgilio congiunto 20 su per lo monte che l’anime cura 21 e discendendo nel mondo defunto,

query.result: 19 ða ða ic wæs mid Firgile gegadrod 20 upp ofer ðone munt ðe ða sawla læceð 21 and nyðer astigende on ða deadan woruld,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 dette mi fuor di mia vita futura 23 parole gravi, avvegna ch’io mi senta 24 ben tetragono ai colpi di ventura;
query.error: **English:** 22 words were spoken to me about my future life, 23 grave words, although I feel 24 well-prepared for the blows of fortune;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 per che la voglia mia saria contenta 26 d’intender qual fortuna mi s’appressa: 27 ché saetta previsa vien più lenta».
query.error: **English:** 25 therefore my desire would be content 26 to understand what fortune approaches me: 27 for a foreseen arrow comes more slowly."
query.result: 25 for ðæm min willa wære bliðe 26 to ongitanne hwylc wyrd me genealæceð: 27 for ðæm ðe gesewen stræl cymeð ðy slawlicor."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Così diss’ io a quella luce stessa 29 che pria m’avea parlato; e come volle 30 Beatrice, fu la mia voglia confessa.
query.error: **English:** 28 Thus I said to that same light 29 that had spoken to me before; and as Beatrice wished, 30 my desire was confessed.
query.result: 28 Þus cwæð ic to ðære leohte selfre 29 ðe ær wið me spræc; and swa swa Beatrice wolde, 30 wæs min willa andgit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 necessità però quindi non prende 41 se non come dal viso in che si specchia 42 nave che per torrente giù discende.
query.error: **English:** 40 but it does not derive necessity from that, 41 except as a ship descending down a river 42 is reflected in the water that it flows through.
query.result: 40 ðearf ðeah ðanon ne onfehð, 41 buton swa swa scip on ðam wætere, 42 ðe of ðam burnan nyðer stigeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Da indi, sì come viene ad orecchia 44 dolce armonia da organo, mi viene 45 a vista il tempo che ti s’apparecchia.
query.error: **English:** 43 From there, just as sweet harmony comes to the ear 44 from an organ, I see the time that awaits you.
query.result: 43 Þanon, swa swa man gehyrð ðurh earan 44 swetesanges dream of organon, me com 45 on gesyhðe se tima ðe ðe gegearwod is.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Qual si partio Ipolito d’Atene 47 per la spietata e perfida noverca, 48 tal di Fiorenza partir ti convene.
query.error: **English:** 46 As Hippolytus departed from Athens 47 because of his ruthless and treacherous stepmother, 48 so you must depart from Florence.
query.result: 46 Swa swa Hippolytus of Athenas gewat 47 for ðære stiðmægan and ðære stiðmægan, 48 ðus scealt of Florence feran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Questo si vuole e questo già si cerca, 50 e tosto verrà fatto a chi ciò pensa 51 là dove Cristo tutto dì si merca.
query.error: **English:** 49 This is what is desired and this is already being sought, 50 and it will soon be accomplished by those who think about it, 51 there where Christ is bought and sold every day.
query.result: 49 Þis is wilned and þis is soht, 50 and þæt sona bið geworht 51 þær Crist is dæghwamlice geboht.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 La colpa seguirà la parte offensa 53 in grido, come suol; ma la vendetta 54 fia testimonio al ver che la dispensa.
query.error: **English:** 52 The fault will follow the offended party 53 in outcry, as is its wont; but vengeance 54 will bear witness to the truth that excuses it.
query.result: 52 Se gylt fylgeð ðære yflan dæd 53 on hryre, swa hit sceal; ac seo wracu 54 bið gewitnes þære soðfæstnysse þe heo alyseð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Tu lascerai ogne cosa diletta 56 più caramente; e questo è quello strale 57 che l’arco de lo essilio pria saetta.
query.error: **English:** 55 You will leave behind every beloved thing 56 most dearly; and this is the arrow 57 that the bow of exile shoots first.
query.result: 55 ðu lætest ælce ðing ðe ðe leof wæs 56 swiðost; and ðæt is se stræl 57 ðe ðæs wræcsiðes boga ærest sceot.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Tu proverai sì come sa di sale 59 lo pane altrui, e come è duro calle 60 lo scendere e ’l salir per l’altrui scale.
query.error: **English:** 58 You will experience how salty is the bread of others, 59 and how hard is the path 60 of going up and down another man's stairs.
query.result: 58 ðu scealt ongietan hu ðæt sælte bræd 59 oðres mannes bið, and hu nearu 60 is ðæs læderes stigel ðe ðu on stigan scealt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

64 che tutta ingrata, tutta matta ed empia 65 si farà contr’ a te; ma, poco appresso, 66 ella, non tu, n’avrà rossa la tempia.

query.result: 64 ðe eal ungeorn, eal unwis and unhold 65 bið ðe ongean; ac, lyt swigor æfter, 66 heo, na ðu, ðæs hafað hyge sorhful.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 per che di provedenza è buon ch’io m’armi, 110 sì che, se loco m’è tolto più caro, 111 io non perdessi li altri per miei carmi.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Giù per lo mondo sanza fine amaro, 113 e per lo monte del cui bel cacume 114 li occhi de la mia donna mi levaro,

115 e poscia per lo ciel, di lume in lume, 116 ho io appreso quel che s’io ridico, 117 a molti fia sapor di forte agrume;

118 e s’io al vero son timido amico, 119 temo di perder viver tra coloro 120 che questo tempo chiameranno antico».

121 La luce in che rideva il mio tesoro 122 ch’io trovai lì, si fé prima corusca, 123 quale a raggio di sole specchio d’oro;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Ma nondimen, rimossa ogne menzogna, 128 tutta tua visïon fa manifesta; 129 e lascia pur grattar dov’ è la rogna.
query.error: **English:** 127 But nevertheless, removing every lie, 128 make your entire vision manifest; 129 and just let them scratch where the itch is.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Ché se la voce tua sarà molesta 131 nel primo gusto, vital nodrimento 132 lascerà poi, quando sarà digesta.
query.error: **English:** 130 For if your voice will be harsh 131 at the first taste, it will leave 132 vital nourishment, once it is digested.
query.result: 130 Gif ðinre stemne bið æt fruman heard, 131 ðonne bið ðæt æfter medmiclum fæc 132 ðurh ðone sweg ðe ðu ðær on sægst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Questo tuo grido farà come vento, 134 che le più alte cime più percuote; 135 e ciò non fa d’onor poco argomento.
query.error: **English:** 133 This cry of yours will do as the wind, 134 which strikes the highest peaks the most; 135 and this makes no small argument for honor.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Però ti son mostrate in queste rote, 137 nel monte e ne la valle dolorosa 138 pur l’anime che son di fama note,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 che l’animo di quel ch’ode, non posa 140 né ferma fede per essempro ch’aia 141 la sua radice incognita e ascosa,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 né per altro argomento che non paia».
query.error: **English:** 142 nor through any other argument that does not appear.
